quote: the eventual creation of a galaxy-ending x-risk seems almost inevitable
issue: Extreme claim lacks sufficient evidence; assumes cumulative probability without considering mitigation or interdependence

quote: they need it needs to be in place
issue: Grammar error - should be "it needs to be in place"

quote: self-propagating expansion of human civilisation
issue: Technical term "self-propagating" used without explanation
Document dated in the future (June 27, 2025) when current date is January 2025

quote: defined here as an event capable of destroying the long-term potential
issue: Definition doesn't match content - many discussed risks explicitly noted as NOT galactic x-risks

quote: Once we expand to other star systems, we may begin
issue: Abstract/summary paragraph appears before Introduction heading without clear labeling

quote: responded to the post on his blog](https://aleph.se/andart2/space/the-end-of-the-worlds/ )
issue: Missing closing bracket after URL, incorrect citation formatting

quote: Introduction
issue: Introduction section disproportionately long compared to other major sections

quote: whether these solar system disasters represented
issue: Unclear antecedent - "these" refers to items in previous post

quote: Don't worry too much about the categories/subheadings here
issue: Repeatedly dismisses importance of categories while continuing to use them throughout

quote: First, that's a lot of death.
issue: Abrupt informal tone shift in academic context

quote: Existential risks to a Galactic Civilisation
issue: Missing methodology section explaining threat identification and categorization approach

quote: Don't worry too much about the categories/subheadings here.
issue: Overly conversational tone disrupts flow

quote: Threats Limited to a One Planet Civilisation
issue: Inconsistent heading formatting - subsections use dashes while main sections use equals signs

quote: arbitrarily advanced technology
issue: Technical term "arbitrarily" needs clarification in this context

quote: spreading to space
issue: Claims threats are "Limited to a One Planet Civilisation" but then mentions they could spread to space

quote: By spreading outside of one's own atmosphere
issue: Awkward phrasing - "one's own" is unnecessarily formal

quote: books.google.co.uk/books?hl=en&lr=&id=MME33bSTCDsC
issue: Google Books URL excessively long, should use shortened citation format

quote: The longest list of threats in this transitionary phase come from stars.
issue: Subject-verb disagreement - should be "comes" not "come"

quote: There are also all sorts of cosmic phenomena
issue: Vague phrasing - "all sorts of" is imprecise

quote: offence will always win
issue: Unsupported assumption that offense dominates defense at all technological scales

quote: destructive capabilities have always been more powerful than defensive
issue: Overgeneralization contradicted by historical examples of successful defense

quote: Societal collapse or loss of value | 10% | ‚ùå
issue: Gives only 10% chance of possibility despite civilizations having collapsed throughout history

quote: If alien-induced galactic x-risks have a non-zero probability
issue: Contradicts line 70 which already concluded probability is "very high", not just "non-zero"

quote: I've included the prevention of astronomical suffering
issue: Claims to include this requirement but it wasn't in the 6 requirements listed above

quote: From hereon I will assume we are the only intelligent life
issue: Abrupt assumption after arguing aliens make long-term future impossible, with no justification

quote: interstellar missions may come before aligned superintelligence
issue: Contradicts own argument that superintelligence is needed before interstellar expansion

quote: dump one end in the Sun and another elsewhere (a la Stephen Baxter's Ring)
issue: Book reference lacks publication details (year, publisher)

quote: Unknowns
issue: Section on unknowns appears before probability analysis sections, disrupting logical flow

quote: I played this game as a kid, there is always a more powerful weapon
issue: Uses childhood game as evidence for cosmic warfare dynamics

quote: To quote Nick Bostrom[36]:
issue: Missing space before footnote reference

quote: most executives spend less than 20% of their time on high-level strategy
issue: Statistical claim lacks source or supporting data

quote: or by the deployment of an initiator bomb
issue: References speculative technology as if established fact without citing evidence

quote: Some key takeaways and hot takes to disagree with me on
issue: Document lacks proper conclusion section, ending with informal "hot takes" instead

quote: How high is pure speculation I think.
issue: Awkward word order - should be "How high, I think, is pure speculation"

quote: Edit: Adding some further reading
issue: Edit note disrupts document flow and should be integrated into main text or appendix

quote: 1. These solar system x-risks were unlikely
issue: Footnotes section (72 entries) too extensive, suggesting poor content integration

quote: I'd assume that I've listed less than 50% of the actual number of galactic x-risks
issue: Admits fundamental uncertainty while making definitive policy recommendations

quote: Self-replicating machines | 100% | ‚úÖ | 75% | ‚ùå
issue: Assigns specific probabilities to highly speculative scenarios without empirical justification

quote: SU(5) is disproven because observational evidence indicates
issue: Scientific claim in footnote 37 lacks supporting citation

quote: Potentially avoided by wormholes or quantum coupling
issue: Footnote 64 makes technical claim without supporting reference

quote: Long & accurate explanation here.
issue: Footnote 54 references content but provides no actual citation or link

quote: Toby Ord gave at EAG London 2025
issue: References a future event (EAG London 2025) as if it already occurred

quote: I'm giving a 15% chance of this happening before 2500
issue: Quoted text in footnote lacks attribution to original author

quote: Some good arguments for why this might take a really long time
issue: Footnote 67 references arguments without citing their source

quote: From hereon I will assume
issue: Should be "From here on" or "Henceforth"

quote: Metaculus predicts 2116 (25%), 2248 (median), >2500 (75%)
issue: Metaculus predictions change over time; these specific percentages may be outdated

quote: conditions 3 to 5 basically describe God
issue: Informal phrasing in academic context

quote: so we don't need to bother now
issue: Overly casual phrasing - "bother" is too informal

quote: Some key takeaways and hot takes to disagree with me on
issue: Extremely informal section heading for academic paper

quote: the probability that a galactic x-risk will eventually be triggered is effectively 100%
issue: Assumes independence of risks and ignores potential for adaptive defenses or coordination

quote: If aliens exist, there is no long-term future
issue: Extreme conclusion from uncertain premises; ignores potential for cooperation or mutual deterrence

quote: Toby Ord. 2025. Forecasting can get easier over longer timeframes. EAG London 2025.
issue: Citation references future conference presentation as if already delivered

quote: basically describe God - all knowing and all powerful
issue: Jumps to extreme solution without considering less authoritarian alternatives

quote: Interstellar travel should be banned until galactic x-risks and galactic governance are solved
issue: Extreme policy prescription based on speculative risks; doesn't weigh against opportunity costs

quote: [1.38 x 10^10^](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Age_of_the_universe)
issue: Incorrect superscript formatting - should be 1.38 √ó 10^10 or 1.38 x 10^10

quote: [this would normally take 10^67 ^years]
issue: Incorrect superscript formatting - should be 10^67 years

quote: include:ozone destruction
issue: Missing space after colon - should be "include: ozone"
